website_summaries.verdict: Inexpensive protection for keeping kids' eyeglasses on their heads.
pros: Soft exterior so it won't cause discomfort to the child who is wearing them
All-black color means these eyewear retainers will go with anything
High quality product that's made in America
cons: May not fit all styles of kids' eyeglasses tightly, so glasses could fall off under pressure

customer_reviews.title: The opening stretches more than you'd think
customer_reviews.text: When I first tried to put these on my son's glasses, I didn't think they would work, but with some finagling, I got the opening over the 11mm end of the arm and they work perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey & Seth

customer_reviews.title: Save a pair of glasses from being lost
customer_reviews.text: My nephew like all kids is never still and constantly jumping and moving around, so we bought these to make sure his glasses would always stay on him and it has totally worked. Before the glasses were left at school but this certainly helped plus the dinosaur figures made it that much easier for him to want to keep them on. The material is strong and the band is stretchy, but not so much where it would be easily lost. There hasn't been any loose strands or tears and its been consistently used everyday since day of purchase. Great retainer for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Couldnt fit
customer_reviews.text: One of my kids lost his on Friday so we need to replacement ASAP before Monday. The item got here on time. However this item is useless! The hole is too small! Couldn't fit any 13 pairs of the glasses we have at home. (All six members of our family from infant to adult wear glasses). We bought from another seller twice and love them. Honestly I dont know if this is original.
customer_reviews.author: Zalia

customer_reviews.title: These are a life saver for my active 9 yr old!
customer_reviews.text: My son (age 9) has been wearing one of these bands for three years now. We replace it 1-2x a year, but he wears it all day, everyday, so it gets a little worn after awhile. It keeps his glasses snugly in his face (no more pushing them up all the time), and is still flexible enough to allow him to slide glasses off his eyes while reading/doing close up stuff (Drs orders). These also have taken the place of sport goggles since children's lenses should be made with anti-shatter glass anyway. We love them and will keep buying them.
customer_reviews.author: Loves Amazon

customer_reviews.title: No more librarian! :)
customer_reviews.text: I have tried so many different things for my 10 year old son. This by far was the most durable. He could never get the right tightness, without it being too tight or too loose. He like to wear the band lower and it still works perfectly. He's got a big round head and has to wear adult glasses and now he doesn't look like a librarian anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda 🤘

customer_reviews.title: Little Big, Does The Job Though
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 1 1/2 year old, it's a little big and his glasses slip off occasionally but all in all its pretty decent. Highly recommend getting some (not sure what they're called) the green ear pieces, they help tremendously.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Charles

customer_reviews.title: Not really worth it for kids.
customer_reviews.text: Supposed to help kids keep their glasses up, but the problem is, it is way too long for them so the strap ends up going above the ear causing discomfort. My son’s ears were all red and irritated after less than a full day of wear. Arrived in poor quality too, the ends were frayed and strings were coming off. Went right into the trash, not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: It was hard to put on my son's glasses. The part where you slide the earpiece in, was to small (& my son had regular kids glasses, nothing fancy). After forcing the earpieces into the hole (it ripped a little), it was extremely hard to put the glasses on my son face. It was literally to tight to fit over his head. I tried to take one side off & put it back on after I got the glasses on his face but that didn't work. I just gave up & threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great strap for youth sports
customer_reviews.text: The strap is ideal for youth sports. Our daughter wears glasses and we didn't want to purchase a separate pair of athletic glasses. This is the perfect solution for her gymnastics competitions. It has kept her glasses in place through hours of practice and events. The strap fits snug to her head so her hair hides it for the most part.
customer_reviews.author: Cloud9mom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for gymnasts who wear glasses
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter who does gymnastics and wears glasses. We had tried a few other kind but this one worked perfect! It makes her ears stick out a little which she had to get used to but other then that its been great! The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that it is a bit hard to get the glasses into the holes but if it wasn't tight, I'm not sure they would stay on as well as they do. I bought a second pair just to have on hand in case she looses the first ones.
customer_reviews.author: ItsJustMe

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but not great
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my son. They do the job and he loves the dinosaurs. However, after only 2 months of use it is already falling apart at the seams. I will probably buy again because my son is tiny and many straps are too big for him, I just wish it stayed together better.
customer_reviews.author: mommyof4

customer_reviews.title: Might be good, depending on why you need it
customer_reviews.text: I suppose your reason for purchasing this will depend on your feelings. I got this because my son's glasses were always sliding down his nose. He's four, and the frames were a size up from what he had been wearing. I found this product difficult to put on, and once I did, I could not get a snug fit around the back of his neck.I was sort of hoping it would mimic the strap on the Miraflex glasses he has worn previously, but it didn't. It would work if you just didn't want the glasses to completely fall off, but they did nothing to help them fit well.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole G.

customer_reviews.title: Tiny, skinny tube, what type of kids glasses could fit in there????
customer_reviews.text: I cannot understand how other reviewers got these to work. The opening in the ends of the tube where you are meant to insert the ends of the glasses are TINY. So unless your child has skinny wire framed glasses with VERY thin arms, it will not fit in this tube. I just cannot get it. All kids glasses have big plastic frames, what are people using these with? I am lost...truly lost.
customer_reviews.author: Brigette Iarrusso

customer_reviews.title: Great for young children
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old grandson entered Kindergarten and began wearing glasses for the first time. He kept taking them off and his teacher suggested a strap to hold them on his neck instead of on the carpeted area for circle time. He loves dinosaurs and has had no issues using this.
customer_reviews.author: Pauline G.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Cute, but my son only wore this for 2 days and the thread was coming out causing the seam to split. It got too uncomfortable as it unraveled that we had to take the strap off his glasses. Lasted less than a week from arrival to throw away
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't get these on
customer_reviews.text: I worked and worked with this strap to get it on my daughter's new pair of glasses but got so frustrated that I just gave up. I have worn glasses most of my life and have used a variety of straps but these were too difficult for me. My daughter and I were both disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie LeMonds

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: These are hard to get over most ear pieces. They are supposed to be snug so they stay on the post, but had a hard time getting them on. When the band is connected to the glasses, the band hangs more around the neck, instead of the back of the head like I imagined. We still used them. Still keeps them from falling to the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great glasses strap for keeping on glasses durring soccer games
customer_reviews.text: This is worked fantastically for keeping my daughters glasses on while playing soccer. If I forget to put it on before her games she runs over to me and says "Mom we need to put my strap-on"! She got the purple and when it arrived it had purple with happy faces and she absolutely loved that! Would definitely buy this product again👍
customer_reviews.author: Leah Kimberley

customer_reviews.title: Cute, useful and durable.
customer_reviews.text: My energetic five-year-old wears this on her glasses from morning to bedtime with no complaints, so it must be comfortable. It's never slipped off the earpieces, even through putting the glasses on, taking them off, swimming, you name it. I've pulled it off to wash a few times, but after 6 months it looks only moderately worn. No fraying, just some little fabric pills forming on the cut edge of the printed side.
customer_reviews.author: Krista Summers

customer_reviews.title: but like these best
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old wears glasses and has issues with them sliding off his face. He also plays roller hockey, so it gives him issues there. We have tried other solutions, but like these best. They keep his glasses on his face, but do not apply so much force that they hurt him. The only issue is that they expand when he sweats (when they are soaked). We adjust them further onto his glasses to compensate, and readjust when they dry.
customer_reviews.author: scodyw

customer_reviews.title: fit too tight on child's sunglasses
customer_reviews.text: these are very cute but the fit was extremely tight and the toddler immediately tried to pull the sunglasses off with these attached. There was no way to know in advance if they'd fit the glasses; I called the manufacturer of the glasses, a different color of the same strap was supposed to fit it was assumed these would work too. They were too tight to make any adjustments
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than new glasses, and saves the new ones from being broken
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a child with broken glasses that kept falling of his face. They solved the problem and allowed him to keep wearing them even while playing outside. The band is comfortable enough that he wears it all the time. He is even able to take the band on and off on his own and adjust it as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan S.

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as replacements since my 11yo son's been wearing these for a few years now. He finds them comfortable and secure. I've washed them many times and let them air dry. They held up pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: ... fit my 5 year old somewhat big but i like that I can slide them up to tighten a ...
customer_reviews.text: These fit my 5 year old somewhat big but i like that I can slide them up to tighten a bit but they do seem to slide back down throughout the day. To put them on in the beginning it was kinda a pain but not a big deal really. Over all they work nicely and are really cute ( she has the purple one with flowers) I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Beder b.

customer_reviews.title: Good for holding metal framed glasses
customer_reviews.text: Needed something to hold my 8 year old's glasses on his head, since he's a special needs kiddo. This works perfectly. His head is a little smaller than kids his age, so I think it would work for a child starting at 5 years old probably. It holds his metal frame glasses beautifully and keeps them on his face and up on his nose. It doesn't appear to bother him at all. It does hold his glasses rather tightly, so it has to be pulled gently off a side, so he can remove his glasses. The design is cute too. Works great, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ewa

customer_reviews.title: Using for teen with Down syndrome
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on and adjust. This is keeping the glasses from falling down my kiddo's nose. We're finding a loose fit is adequate to prevent "frame migration." Loose fit keeps the glasses in place without putting pressure on nose or ears.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Secures My 6-Year-Old Daughter's Glasses Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Croakies Kids band to help keep my daughter's plastic frame glasses on her head. They were always slipping down her nose or falling off when running outside. This works perfectly to keep them secure on her face! It's comfortable to wear (believe me, she would tell me if it wasn't), it slips easily and tightly onto the temple ends and stays securely, and it is easily adjusted for comfort. She does have a little trouble getting it on the glasses by herself, but that's not a problem for us. Another plus is that it looks cute and not tacky at all. I plan on buying another in pink. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Fits as expected for a 5.5 year old.
customer_reviews.text: It looks just like it does in the picture. Perfect for a 5.5 year old boy. Fits glasses very well. I only gave durability 4 stars because I am not sure how it will hold up I will come back and update it later.
customer_reviews.author: April C. 1010

customer_reviews.title: Measure your baby’s head to be sure it won’t be too large.
customer_reviews.text: A little bigger than I thought it would be . The part that fits into the glasses is a tiny opening. I got it on the glasses with great effort. It won’t come off the glasses that’s for sure! It’s very cute!
customer_reviews.author: Buying grandma

customer_reviews.title: Great and hold well for athletes
customer_reviews.text: Got two sets for my eleven year old son who plays soccer indoor and outdoor. They hold his glasses on, and he is a goalie so he’s always jumping and diving.
customer_reviews.author: mommyofallboys

customer_reviews.title: Good product, slow delivery
customer_reviews.text: I really like these croakies I ordered for my 3 yr old's glasses. They're cute, seem sturdy, and will fit him a long time. Unfortunately, even though I ordered next day shipping, they didn't arrive until evening 3 days later. When it's a matter of my preschooler being able to see & use his glasses, 3 days is longer than I'd like, especially when I paid for next day shipping & didn't get it. I will likely order them elsewhere next time.
customer_reviews.author: K Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Slides off frame
customer_reviews.text: Slides off the kids frames easy, could be that my son just has a Wide head, could be because the frames are plastic.
customer_reviews.author: gena sonnenberg

customer_reviews.title: Super cute, great fit for my 4 year old!
customer_reviews.text: Getting his first glasses was exciting, keeping them on was another story! These Croakies are comfy, sporty and the bright lizard design is perfect for my backyard explorer. Fast shipping and excellent service. Thanks so much!
customer_reviews.author: Prov31mama

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: A must have if you're child participates in an activity that requires these!! Perfect fit, comfortable, and so far have kept my 9 year old son's glasses secure both on a big rollercoaster and a trampoline park. I highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: webgurll

customer_reviews.title: Good idea--didn't fit
customer_reviews.text: This product was purchased for my granddaughter who is new at wearing glasses and was having trouble keeping her glasses up on her nose. Her sunglasses have temple pieces that are too wide to fit in the Croakies so it is a disappointment that they cannot be used at this time. We were able to get her regular glasses adjusted so that the Croakies are not needed however, we tried them on the frames and they were still a tight fit.
customer_reviews.author: GG central

customer_reviews.title: Not good for all sizes
customer_reviews.text: My daughter's glasses did not fit, my daughter's glasses with a wide hand did not fit her at all .. It fit glasses with a thin hand ..
customer_reviews.author: Lean amr

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little strap for my little girl’s glasses. She plays basketball and her glasses stay put!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for my 4 year olds sunglasses.
customer_reviews.text: Great for sunglasses. We are using it just for that. It is just "slack" enoughto make it convenient to pit the glasses on and off when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Bluedevil01

customer_reviews.title: Fits small heads
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been looking for something like this for soooo long! I have a 15 month old that wears glasses and every strap is always too big for her. I am so happy!
customer_reviews.author: Haircolorbycarissa

customer_reviews.title: Great investment in my son's glasse
customer_reviews.text: These Eyeglass retainers have worked for my son (8 years old now) for over 3 years now!! He has broken probably over 5 pairs of glasses in that time and just slid them off the old glasses and slid on the new ones. The only issue is some of the thread is coming undone a few months ago. It's not bad but I did notice it. Overall I would say a great investment in my son's glasses!
customer_reviews.author: CakeSmasher

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. This says it's for kids, but it doesn't fit over the larger ear pieces for kid glasses. I even called Croakies and they said this was the correct item.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: so I will make the assumption they are comfortable for him
customer_reviews.text: I put these on all my son's sunglasses! I actually cut the back and put velcro on it for them to stay in place in a snug position close to the back of his head. He will keep these on all day, so I will make the assumption they are comfortable for him.
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn.amazonshopper

customer_reviews.title: Here are Exact Measurements
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our 4 year old daughter and it works great. Since every kids head is different I measured the band for this review: *Total Length of Band - 13 inches (this includes the length of the band on both sides that is folded over to hold the glasses ear piece). The material is pretty stretchy and can stretch to a full length of 15 inches. *2.25-2.5 inches on either side of the band is sewn narrow to accommodate the glasses. Depending on the size of your kids head you can insert the glasses ear piece all the way into the band or just partially. Width of Band - The band is 3/4 inches wide at the widest point
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: GRANDSON'S NEW GLASSES AND NEW GLASSES BAND
customer_reviews.text: This has been very useful in having my grandson wear his glasses, he loves dinosaurs and this motivates and reminds him he needs his glasses for school.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They work great!
customer_reviews.text: They work great! My daughters glasses dont slip off when shes playing soccer anymore
customer_reviews.author: K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: A little tricky to find the perfect fit. If you make them too tight
customer_reviews.text: A little tricky to find the perfect fit. If you make them too tight, they will annoy you. Keep them a little loose and they are comfortable and will never fall off.
customer_reviews.author: David M LaBuda

customer_reviews.title: The length is great & this would have been perfect
customer_reviews.text: The opening where you slide the arms of the glasses in are way to small. My son is 3 & these were too tight to get on his glasses. The length is great & this would have been perfect, but only buy them if you have a wire frame that is very very skinny.
customer_reviews.author: BambiWatson

customer_reviews.title: Great product for kids
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect! We took the ear pieces off my son's glasses and used these as a tight strap, like a sports strap. Worked like a charm! They are soft, and very cute, too!
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I love it cause it is easy for my son to keep his glasses on when he is playing.
customer_reviews.author: Milagros soto

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and good looking strap
customer_reviews.text: It looks really nice. It is comfortable and good material. I will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Fco

customer_reviews.title: Great buy !
customer_reviews.text: Loved the size for my almost 4 year old. Finish and stretch is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: dp

customer_reviews.title: Cute, but uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I truly love the design.. but unfortunately it was so uncomfortable wearing his glasses with this retainer.
customer_reviews.author: Raffie

customer_reviews.title: Fun way to keep glasses on your active kids
customer_reviews.text: Granddaughter loves it. She where them when she's playing Tee ball, and they keep her glasses from slipping off while she's running.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Good item
customer_reviews.text: Good item for my son. Beats having to get goggles.
customer_reviews.author: Langelica

customer_reviews.title: Cute and comfy
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son. It fits him fine and it’s cute.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Durable!
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews of this and similar products before ordering and I was concerned that the band might be too big for my son (5) and his first pair of glasses. I figured I'd just cut the ends off a bit if that was the case, but they fit just fine. They aren't really intended to hold the glasses tightly on to the head anyhow-we haven't had issues with them falling off or anything else like that. The print is cute and so far it seems to be pretty durable. Will order again.
customer_reviews.author: batikchik

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: works great for my 4yrs old glasses. He lives the dinos on it too. it does seem to push his ears out a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Halla Van Zee

customer_reviews.title: Finally a eye glass cord for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: My son, who is two, started wearing glasses this year. I bought several other cords and none of them would fit. They were all to big even if they were adjustable. THEN I FOUND THESE!!!! I was so excited!!! THEY ARE ADJUSTABLE for TODDLERS AND FIT PERFECTLY ON MY SON. I am so thankful that I found a product that holds my son's glasses and is easy to use. Thank you for offering these on Amazon
customer_reviews.author: W. Stenback

customer_reviews.title: Works well on my 4yo
customer_reviews.text: We really liked this for our 4yo son. It fits his head well and prevents slipping whenever he is wearing his eye patch. The only down side is that the ends of are unfinished, so it doesn’t look which as nice on the ends. The product works exactly as it should though.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great Item
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nephew and he loves it. He wears his glasses everyday just to show this off. We also no longer have to worry about him dropping them. Awesome product and he will defiantly use this for a long while.
customer_reviews.author: Raifert

customer_reviews.title: It does its job fine, now that it's been altered to fit
customer_reviews.text: It took some modification to make it fit my son's head. He's not at all small for his age, so this shouldn't have been an issue. It does its job fine, now that it's been altered to fit.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: it was good for my little boy especially because his glasses would ...
customer_reviews.text: it was good for my little boy especially because his glasses would fall off and he was not use to wearing them on.
customer_reviews.author: Orozco

customer_reviews.title: Works well for preschooler
customer_reviews.text: This fit my average sized 4 year old son well. It helps to keep his glasses from flying off when he's playing. He's been using it for a couple months now and it seems to be stretching out a bit, and the stitching on the arm part is coming out a bit on one side. He has dark brown hair so the strap blends in well. I've hand washed and dried with no issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: girl in SF

customer_reviews.title: 5 year loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My son says it is comfortable and I had no difficulty getting him to wear it. He lives that his glasses stay in place now! It is a little difficult to get one but not much
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: My son has glaucoma and has to wear prescription glasses but he recently switched from Mira flex to standard glasses and he doesn’t have a nose bridge so these were perfect for keeping his glasses up! I highly recommend them an big plus is the dinosaurs on the back
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Frame earpiece has to be x-small. Description is misleading.
customer_reviews.text: We have these bands, purchased in a retail store, and needed a back up. The product description is incomplete. Even though it says it fits medium frames, what it really needs to emphasize is that the frame EARPIECE has to be x-small. My daughters frames are small- medium, and these croaked retainer cords do not fit her earpiece. It's very frustrating, especially because these things are not cheap.
customer_reviews.author: FitnessMom

customer_reviews.title: Glasses retainer 1/10
customer_reviews.text: Poorly made my son used it once and said they hurt his head at the seam it has already unstitched . They do work for keeping the glasses into place but not a comfortable wear it leaves imprints behind my sons ears .
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for my Toddler's glasses.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 3 year old autistic daughter who had trouble keeping her glasses on. These keep them on her face comfortably and she does not try to pull at them because they are sitting correctly. We have bought three of these and will continue to buy them!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Pottgen

customer_reviews.title: The same quality as 25 years ago
customer_reviews.text: Great quality to be expected. Kid loves it. Kind of hard to get on the frames but once hard it’s been good for a wild 5 yo boy.
customer_reviews.author: FilmComposer

customer_reviews.title: Must have for active kids with glasses
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for our grandson who is just four years old. Not only are they super cute but they are super durable and hold his glasses on even when jumping on the trampoline! He is able to maneuver his glasses on and off easily with the strap attached.
customer_reviews.author: sabrina redmond

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the beach
customer_reviews.text: Kept my daughter's sunglasses from ending up in Davy Jones's locker or on some sea turtle's face. Get your own sunglasses, turtle!
customer_reviews.author: J. Hawley

customer_reviews.title: Durable and cute child’s glasses strap
customer_reviews.text: The strap was bought for my 4 yr old son. He complains that the crease part of the strap bothers him but otherwise this strap is amazing. He loves that there are dinosaurs on it. It is durable. Has kept his glasses on just the way we wanted them to.
customer_reviews.author: VioletDelta

customer_reviews.title: Much better price than paying for athletic glasses
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my four year old and it fits just right. Sometimes, she complains that it is too tight, but I am able to adjust it without compromising the fit. Her glasses stay put. Much better price than paying for athletic glasses!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort and perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for chums without the long tail or string for my sons everyday glasses he has to wear. These worked perfectly. Not only are they comfortable for him, but also provide a clean simple look. Just what we were looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Allyson Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: My son still managed to destroy his glasses but these bad boys survived
customer_reviews.author: Cátia

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 8 year old who lost his glasses twice already. The fit is perfect. It is not too loose or too tight (I even tried them with a pair of glasses and they fit me a bit tight but it could have worked for me as well). The glasses fit also and they don't slide or move. We will see how they do once he is in school.
customer_reviews.author: despond

customer_reviews.title: 6 year old loves it
customer_reviews.text: Fits snugly on the frames of my daughters sunglasses. I was worried she wouldn't like how it felt around her head, but she loves the print and says it's comfortable. When she wants to take them off, they fit loosely around her neck. Pleased with this purchase, and should keep her glasses close at hand when we go to a theme park this summer.
customer_reviews.author: GoodNoodle

customer_reviews.title: Worked GREAT! His glasses stayed on his head
customer_reviews.text: Son used these on his prescription eyeglasses on a white water rafting trip. Worked GREAT! His glasses stayed on his head...even when he jumped into the river to swim. Will use this brand again!
customer_reviews.author: Wombat1

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for my 5 year old
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for my 5 year old. Fits perfectly, arrived timely, is comfortable and does not snag the hair. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Ranke Lidyek

customer_reviews.title: perfect for my son
customer_reviews.text: He has been wearing the retainer band for months now. We did have to modify it as the openings to the croakies were not big enough for his glasses. We tied the croakies on both sides of the ear pieces. It looks and feels good to him. They keep the glasses on for soccer. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: amazon shopper

customer_reviews.title: but the good news is that that means he'll have a hard ...
customer_reviews.text: These hold glasses on well. I did have a hard time even getting them on to my son's regular glasses, but the good news is that that means he'll have a hard time getting them off, which I like. I liked them enough that I'll be buying more for my youngest child's sunglasses, since he's constantly taking them off.
customer_reviews.author: Christy H.

customer_reviews.title: They are like black plastic type so it is somewhat large at ...
customer_reviews.text: Was hard to put on my 10 yr old kids glasses but got it on after a fight. They are like black plastic type so it is somewhat large at the end. Probably easier to fit on metal wire frame type glasses. Good i only need to put on once or twice a week.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter to use during gymnastics-as the eye doctor told us that she can't see without her glasses-and she's not ready for contacts. She loves the fun pattern on the band-and it holds her glasses on very well. It fits various size ear piece widths, as the fabric is stretchy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must for our kids at the beach and at the pool
customer_reviews.text: Our family went to the beach this year and these were a MUST for our 3 and 7 year old. We got $2 sun glasses from children's place (bought about 5 pairs each) and bought one of these croakies per child and yes they float and they look super cute, no more left behind or lost or drowned sunglasses!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca L. P.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Fits my son’s Disney sunglasses and holds them in place. He is almost 4 and this is a good size for him.
customer_reviews.author: Love to skate

customer_reviews.title: Not elastic
customer_reviews.text: It is not that elastic and adajustable. I ended up DIY a band by connecting four rubber bands, which works much better than this.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel10497

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: Garbage! Right out of the package it began to unthread as I was inserting my sons sunglasses in it. Went straight in the garbage. Wasted money.
customer_reviews.author: J. Donigan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Fit my son's babiators perfectly (and much cheaper than the babiators accessory kit)
customer_reviews.author: Sara Diniz

customer_reviews.title: Croakies are the best!
customer_reviews.text: Croakies have the best glasses bands. Cool and comfortable, they are my five year olds favorite!!
customer_reviews.author: Shigejii

customer_reviews.title: Good buy, but install takes a while
customer_reviews.text: Its difficult to put the glasses in the holder, but I suppose that makes them effective in not falling off. My son wears these in his basketball games and they seem to do their job. I would recommend for the price, but give yourself 15 mins to install.
customer_reviews.author: IT_Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great for Small noses!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 6 year old who’s sunglasses tend so constantly slip down his nose. The extra cushion on the sides help keep them up on his face!
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for making such a great product!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my grandson - to use during soccer practice & games. He loves it and I am thrilled his glasses are securely on his face, right where they belong, while he is playing soccer! Thanks for making such a great product!
customer_reviews.author: VLAM87

customer_reviews.title: Small but works.
customer_reviews.text: Beware , the opening for the arm pieces are pretty small. I tied them in a knot to my son's sunglasses because the arm pieces were too fat for the opening to the croakies. They work perfectly , with the modification.
customer_reviews.author: amazon shopper

customer_reviews.title: Confidence for your sporting kids with glasses
customer_reviews.text: My daughters uses they for gymnastics and ballet. She loves them and uses them daily.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck N

customer_reviews.title: holes to slide the glasses in are way to small ...
customer_reviews.text: holes to slide the glasses in are way to small to fit over glasses, even wire rimmed ones. returned this product
customer_reviews.author: RCB119

customer_reviews.title: Not easily adjusted
customer_reviews.text: No way to adjust except sliding up ear part of glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Travis D

customer_reviews.title: It does keep my sons glasses in place well but ...
customer_reviews.text: It does keep my sons glasses in place well but the hole for where the glasses have to fit through to keep them in place is a little tight and had a hard time getting them in.
customer_reviews.author: SuJung

customer_reviews.title: Wish that the part the fit over the arm of ...
customer_reviews.text: Wish that the part the fit over the arm of the glasses was thinner, as it bothers my son's ears. It also just hangs at the back of his neck, so too big. It's very cute though, and serves the purpose of having him keep his glasses on.
customer_reviews.author: sabrco

customer_reviews.title: Crokies were a big hit
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter was thrilled to receive these in the mail. We looked for croakies in the big name brand sport shops and couldn't find any that were specifically for children. The adult sizes were all too big. I received a call with many thanks and to let me know how well they fit this 8 year old.
customer_reviews.author: carol johnson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and Stylish
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my 18 month old daughter who is now 2. She continues to use these with her glasses and will be able to for some time until she outgrows it. The color remains bright. The elasticity remains strong and most importantly, her glasses remain on her face! She loves the flowers on the band as well.
customer_reviews.author: cboehlke

product_meta.title: Croakies Kids Eyewear Retainer
product_meta.description: In 1977 a ski patrolman came up with an idea for an eyewear retainer that would grip his shades through all kinds of alpine adventures. He grabbed an old wetsuit, some sharp scissors, and a good idea, then he made the first pair of eyewear retainers. The ingenious device was based on the design of a Chinese finger trap. Croakies are produced in the USA at their production facility in Bozeman, Montana. Having been used by all types of people, doing all kinds of activities all over the world, Croakies were then introduced to SPACE. They became standard equipment for the crew on the space shuttle in 1990. Croakies uses top quality components to create all their products. They build Croakies eyewear retainers with a number of different materials but all offer durability, functionality and style. Croakies is all about getting out and exploring life’s big adventures. “Love Life. Play Outside.”
feature_bullets: Designed to fit frame arm size up to 1/4 inch wide
